text: But they'd take weeks to assemble.

text: What kind of man is he?
title: Braveheart

text: Not a king like you, my Lord.

text: You may return to your embroidery.

text: You brought back the money, of course?

text: That's what happenswhen you send a woman.

text: A personal escort of the Princess.

text: I didn't think you were in the tent that long.

text: I don't know about the Welsh yet,but the Irish have landed.

text: I had to see it myself to believe it.

text: What are the Irish doingfighting with the English?

text: I wouldn't worry about them.Didn't I tell you before?

text: Hamish, ride ahead to Edinburghand assemble the council. Order it!

text: - We'll have to negotiate.- Please, gentlemen!

text: This time our only option is to negotiate.

text: My army has marchedfor more days than I can remember.

text: We won at Stirling, and still you quibble!

text: Please, Sir William, speak with me alone.

text: In the name of Christ, help yourselves!

text: ...and there is strength in you, I see it.

text: So how does it help usto join the side that is slaughtered?

text: You and you alone can rule Scotland.

text: What I tell you, you must do.

text: Ah, good to see ye this morning!

text: Send us news of our victory.

text: - Get him out of here!- Jesus!

text: We must have alliancewith England to prevail here.

text: In time, you will haveall the power in Scotland.

text: Sir William, we come to seek a meeting.

text: You've all sworn Ioyalty to Longshanks.

text: An oath to a liar is no oath at all.

text: Every man of us is readyto swear Ioyalty to you.

text: We cannot.Some scarcely believe you're alive.

text: So we bid you to Edinburgh.

text: Meet us two days from now. Pledge usyour pardon and we'll unite behind you.

text: - You mean us and you.- No.

text: It's the pledge of Robert the Bruce.

text: You do know it's a trap. Tell him!

text: All right, leaving him aside,what about the others?

text: Scheming bastards who couldnae agree onthe colour of shite! It's a trap! Are you blind?

text: We can't do this alone. Joining the noblesis the only hope for our people.

title: Braveheart

text: - I don't want to be a martyr.- Nor I.

text: I want a home, and children. And peace.

text: I've asked God for those things.It's all for nothing if you don't have freedom.
